Description: Nile silt pottery vase coated on the exterior with red slip with black top and burnished, flat base, slightly convex sides and wide mouth, with slightly everted lip. Incised post-firing with a vegetal-motif on one side of the body and a serpent-motif on the other side. The interior is untreated.
Curator's comments: Marked B138 on the side. Like Black top red ware B21d in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery (1921). Potmarks illustrated in W.M.F Petrie and A.C. Mace, Diospolis Parva, London (1901), pl. xxi.36.
Condition: fari; exterior surface worn, rim chipped.
